definition: Chairman Mao/Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 (1893-1976), Chinese Communist leader

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
surname Mao
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
variant of 席[xi2]/woven mat
surname Xi
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc
Quotations from Chairman Mao Tse-Tung, published from 1964 to about 1976
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Premier Zhou Enlai 周恩來|周恩来 (1898-1976)
Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976

Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Deng Xiaoping (1904-1997), Chinese communist leader, de facto leader of PRC 1978-1990 and creator of "socialism with Chinese characteristics"
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army
Lin Biao (1908-1971), Chinese army leader at time of the Cultural Revolution
Hua Guofeng (1921-2008), leader of Chinese Communist Party after the Cultural Revolution
Hu Yaobang (1915-1989), Chinese politician
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Luo Ronghuan (1902-1963), Chinese communist military leader
Li Xiannian (1909-1992), PRC general and politician
He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader
Dong Biwu (1886-1975), one of the founders of the Chinese communist party
